category: Beach / Uninhabited Island & Lagoon / Marine Eco-Tourism / Resort Island
timings: Access largely daylight hours; resort stays operate year-round when weather permits. Sea and boat transfers depend on sea/weather. Not documented fixed “opening/closing” hours.
entry_fee: Resort cost for accommodation; permit required to enter Lakshadweep (travellers must obtain permit via Lakshadweep administration) and charges for boat/sea transfer. Specific ₹ amount for entry Not documented.
best_time: October to May — fair season, calm seas, good for water sports and diving. Monsoon period (approx mid-May to September) brings heavy rains & rough seas.
nearest_railway: None on island; nearest mainland railhead is Kochi Railway Station, approx ~400 km + sea transfer (via Agatti)
nearest_bus: Not applicable on island; mainland Kochi bus stands serve for initial travel.
nearest_airport: Agatti Airport (Agatti Island) — Bangaram is ~12 km by boat from Agatti Airport.
accessibility: Reachable by flight to Agatti then boat; island is uninhabited so access limited to resort guests; no roads; walking on beaches only; no wheelchair infrastructure.
guided_tours: Yes through resort operators / Lakshadweep tourism packages; water-sports instructors; snorkeling / scuba guides.
parking: At Agatti Island for initial leg; Bangaram resort guests arrange boat transfers; parking not applicable on Bangaram itself beyond resort area.
nearby_amenities: Resort cottages, restaurant at the resort; minimal infrastructure beyond that; supply from Agatti.
special_notes: Known for phosphorescent plankton which glow bioluminescent at night; pristine coral reefs; one of the more secluded islands; unpolluted environment.
